pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru
meanings: carrying (someone) on one's back (esp. a child)

pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru

lessons.japanese: あの若夫婦は今でも親におんぶに抱っこだ。
lessons.english: That young couple are still tied to their parent's apron strings.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は赤ん坊をおんぶしていた。
lessons.english: She carried a baby on her back.

lessons.japanese: 日本の女性は赤ん坊を背中におんぶする。
lessons.english: Japanese women carry their babies on their backs.

lessons.japanese: 日本の女性は赤ん坊を背中におんぶする。
lessons.english: Japanese women carry their babies on their backs.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は赤ん坊をおんぶしていた。
lessons.english: She carried a baby on her back.

lessons.japanese: あの若夫婦は今でも親におんぶに抱っこだ。
lessons.english: That young couple are still tied to their parent's apron strings.

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けないよ！ねえ、おんぶして！
lessons.english: I can't walk anymore, Dad! Carry me please!

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けないよ！ねえ、おんぶして！
lessons.english: I can't walk anymore, Dad! Carry me please!

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けないよ！ねえ、おんぶして！
lessons.english: Daddy, I can't walk any more. Could you give me a piggyback ride?

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けないよ！ねえ、おんぶして！
lessons.english: Daddy, I can't walk any more. Carry me.

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けないよ！ねえ、おんぶして！
lessons.english: Daddy, I can't walk any more. Could you give me a piggyback ride?

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けないよ！ねえ、おんぶして！
lessons.english: Daddy, I can't walk any more. Carry me.

lessons.japanese: 子供たちをおんぶしてました。
lessons.english: We carried our children on our backs.

lessons.japanese: 子供たちをおんぶしてました。
lessons.english: We carried our children on our backs.
